page.title: 07Bluemull Sound Ferry,Fivla.
page.content: The new Bluemull Sound ferry is called the Fivla which means Water Fairy.The old Fivla was launched in 1973 and sold to Newfoundland in 1983.The new Fivla began her work on Bluemull Sound on Monday 22nd April 1985. The new Fivla was built by the Ferguson Ailsa Yard at Troon.She cost Â£1,030,00;Â£309,000 of which was given as a grant by the European Regional Development Fund.The rest was paid by the Shetland Islands' Council.She is 30 metres long and is painted blue and white with red funnels. The ferry can take 15 cars and 95 passengers on the Yell-Unst run,but only 50 passengers on the Fetlar run. The Official Naming Ceremony,with the customary bottle of champagne which took two attempts to break,was held at Mid Yell on the morning of 29th April 1985.
